ygData.subject: Re: clinging darkness question
ygData.msgSnippet: ... From: atrocity apocalypse [mailto:atrocity_apocalypse@yahoo.com] Sent: June 30, 1999 1:16 PM To: shadowknight@onelist.com Subject: [shadowknight] clinging
ygData.messageBody:
-----Original Message-----
From: atrocity apocalypse [mailto:atrocity_apocalypse@...]
Sent: June 30, 1999 1:16 PM
To: shadowknight@onelist.com
Subject: [shadowknight] clinging darkness question

While you cannot stack two clinging darkness spells on top of each other,
you can stack different types of spells such as disease cloud, clinging
darkness, and heat blood. Now that will add up to some serious atrophication
hehe.
From: atrocity apocalypse <atrocity_apocalypse@...>

I've just reached the 15th level and am having a blast with my new
spells. My question for more experienced shadowkinghts is, is clinging
darkness cumulative? In other words if I cast it on an npc twice am I
getting twice the effect, or is there no difference. Also, how long
does the effect persist for?

I've also been using fear, but it seems to fizzle quite a bit. It's
been very handy when I'm low on health from fighting something and then
get jumped by a fire elemental or something. I usually try to switch
targets and fear the new attacker so I can finish off the first and
run. It gets a bit dangerous when I'm under a bubble and fear keeps
fizzling though.

Thanks,

Atrocity
Bertoxulous
